channel.title: Amazon Web Services Service Status
Current service status feed for Amazon Web Services.
channel.generator: AWS Service Health Dashboard RSS Generator

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Network Connectivity
item.description: Between 6:23 AM and 6:32 AM PST and between 8:11 AM and 8:21 AM PST, customers in the US-EAST-1 Region may have experienced Internet connectivity issues. The root cause of this issue was a loss of power in one of our network peering facilities. Our network is designed to be fully redundant with multiple independent peering facilities in every region. Some customers experienced elevated latency and packet loss while the network rerouted affected traffic to these unaffected network peering facilities. Some packet loss was also observed as we restored traffic to the affected network peering facility. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Network Connectivity
item.description: Between 6:23 AM and 10:26 AM PST on March 2, 2018, some customers in the CoreSite VA1 & VA2 (Reston, VA) Direct Connect location and the Equinix DC1 - DC6 & DC10 - DC12 (Ashburn, VA) Direct Connect location experienced a connection loss to the US-EAST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Network Connectivity
item.description: Connections in the CoreSite VA1 & VA2 (Reston, VA) location, and some connections in the Equinix DC1 - DC6 & DC10 - DC12 (Ashburn, VA) location are inactive. Inactive connections are not receiving routes advertised from Direct Connect routers. We are now working to restore service on these Direct Connect connections. The AWS VPN service is operating normally and may be an alternative for some workloads.

item.title: Informational message: Network Connectivity
item.description: We continue to work towards resolving the increased packet loss impacting AWS Direct Connect connectivity to the US-EAST-1 Region. Direct Connect connections from the Equinix DC1 - DC6 & DC10 - DC12, Ashburn, VA and CoreSite VA1 & VA2, Reston, VA locations are affected by this issue.

item.title: Informational message: Network Connectivity
item.description: We are investigating increased packet loss possibly impacting some AWS Direct Connect customers in the US-EAST-1 Region.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Elevated DNS Resolution Errors
item.description: Between 2:41 PM and 2:56 PM PST some EC2 instances experienced elevated DNS resolution errors in the EU-CENTRAL-1 Region. As a result of this, some AWS services experienced elevated errors and increased latency. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Elevated DNS Resolution Errors
item.description: Between 2:41 PM and 2:56 PM PST some EC2 instances experienced elevated DNS resolution errors in the EU-WEST-1 Region. As a result of this, some AWS services experienced elevated errors and increased latency. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Launch Error Rates
item.description: We have resolved the issue affecting new launches of C5 and M5 instance types in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region. Existing instances were not affected. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Launch Error Rates
item.description: We can confirm increased error rates for new launches of C5 and M5 instance types in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region. We have identified the root cause and are working toward full resolution. In the interim, we recommend customers launch their instances to an alternate Availability Zone.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Launch Error Rates
item.description: We are investigating increased error rates for new launches of C5 and M5 instance types in a single Availability Zone in the US-WEST-2 Region.

item.title: Informational message: [RESOLVED] Elevated Console and API Error Rates
item.description: Between 1:31 AM and 2:18 AM PST, we experienced elevated error rates for the CloudFront Management Console and API calls to manage distribution configurations and invalidations. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Increased Invoke API Error Rates
item.description: Between 4:03 PM and 4:57 PM PST we experienced increased API error rates and latencies in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Error Rates
item.description: Between 11:43 AM and 12:48 PM PDT we experienced increased error rates for Autoscaling API calls in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.

item.title: Informational message: Increased Error Rates
item.description: We are investigating increased error rates for Autoscaling API calls in the US-GOV-WEST-1 Region.

item.title: Informational message: [RESOLVED] Increased API Error Rates
item.description: Between 7:41 AM and 8:04 AM PST we experienced increased API error rates in the AP-SOUTH-1 Region. The issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
